title: Judicial appointment of guardian; professional
context: ยง560:5-306 Judicial appointment of guardian; professional evaluation. At or before a hearing under this part, the court may order a professional evaluation of the respondent and shall order the evaluation if the respondent so demands. If the court orders the evaluation, the respondent shall be examined by a physician, psychologist, or other individual appointed by the court who is qualified to evaluate the respondent&rsquo;s alleged impairment. The examiner shall promptly file a written report with the court. Unless otherwise directed by the court, the report shall contain: (1) A description of the nature, type, and extent of the respondent&rsquo;s specific cognitive and functional limitations; (2) An evaluation of the respondent&rsquo;s mental and physical condition and, if appropriate, educational potential, adaptive behavior, and social skills; (3) A prognosis for improvement and a recommendation as to the appropriate treatment or habilitation plan; and (4) The date of any assessment or examination upon which the report is based. [L 2004, c 161, pt of ยง1]
